channel.title: installing cinematic mod
channel.description:
so, I managed to access the installer from the RAR files of cinematic mod 10 LE, but just after it begins installation it comes up with an error message saying Archive bin.zip: the zip file could not be found.
anyone know what the problem is?
help will be appreciated.

item.description:
Omega_Absolute:

wait wait wait wait… you mean to tell me someone WANTS to install cinematic mod?

If you turn off all the immersion breaking HD character models, it creates a nice change that makes the game just different enough for more fun on a replay.

item.title: installing cinematic mod
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
Savant:

I’m not in mood to wait for 4 seperate downloads to finish.

https://www.exp.de/download.php?id=16861

The site is in German, click one of the 4 possiblites under “Bitte Mirror auswählen” and then click on “Download starten”. If it doesn’t work, try one of the others.

Well, it’s the beta, but you can download the “whole” thing at once.

I think there is a patch, where you can just overwrite this one, to the final version.

It should be completely in English, when you downloaded it

Read full topic

item.title: installing cinematic mod
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
I wish they’d just go and figure out how to make a good high definition valve alyx instead of miss titsmcLima, and give her some decent clothes. I usually went for the nano-suit version because: A: it was the least horrifically perky of them and B: because regular alyx looked out of place with hq-Kleiner and Eli. And what the fuck was with those jackets they gave all the females?

But putting extra in-yo-face boobs aside, it was really not a bad modification at all. I loved what they did to alot of the levels, and if your computer can handle it, it really adds to the immersion. They got rid of a lot of the 2d tree backdrops in MANY areas and replaced them with entities, and foliage-d up the whole damned thing. Sometimes it’s excessive, but hey, nobody around to trim it. And the fact that they made it so the oddly fast night-day-night sequence from Ravenholm, along the coast, and to Nova Prospekt one LONG night, made more sense in my book. The latest update did something I am very angry about though. Up until the latest update, the Episode 2 vortigaunt-antlion showdown around Alyx had an, albeit modified, original HL2 track, Vortal Combat, I believe. They removed it in favor of a movie track, just like they did all the other. While in most cases, it didn’t hurt the game, it really struck a blow to me.

But all in all, map enhancements = yay, character enhancements = nay.

Read full topic

item.title: installing cinematic mod
item.dc:creator: m3rc1l3ss
item.description:
I honestly liked all the redone models, other than Alyx who even the creator says needs more work. If you have 4gb of ram to spare, just grab the mega version and be done with it, the game may not be exactly the same, but visually the improvement was completely worth it. Additionally since it is a mod you should technically be able to have both versions installed at the same time and find which is better for you…

(I only ran CM 8 and that was before lite version, so I had to do some creative settings changes to get it to even do anything, and I can say even not getting everything the changes are awesome.)

Read full topic

item.title: installing cinematic mod
item.dc:creator: blackout
item.description:
ok then. but two things, one, can someone give me a detailed run-through of how to extract the files, 'cos last time I screwed it up (I know how you actually extract them, but I need a detailed & thorough explaination and two, how do you turn off the shitty HD models, as well as the unecessary new soundtrack?

Read full topic

item.title: installing cinematic mod
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
blackout:

yeah I already said, I’m only downloading the light edition; no new models or soundtrack, I hate the HD models.

That’s not what I said. I said the non-lite version or the normal version (heavy version? whatever you call it) will still allow you to turn off the HD character models if those are your only complaint. So if lite version isn’t working you can still download that and turn off the terrible HD character models.

blackout:

then why did he say not to?

Because he expects 99% of people to use the included installer and the installer is designed to work with the .zip file. If you unzip it and move things around you’ll prevent the installer from working which would confuse most of the people installing the mod.

Read full topic

Edit 2: ok, I tried extracting, and fucked up, I totally lost track. I’ll try a different download link.

item.title: installing cinematic mod
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
You have to unzip the installer and all of those, but there’s another file inside the data folder (or some such folder) that is also zipped you don’t want to touch.

Unfortunately, I imagine you’ll have to go ahead and re-download the entire thing.

As other people have said, don’t turn on the HD models. They may look better, but they kill the atmosphere in every way. You can still turn them off with the non-lite version.

Read full topic
